page.title: 13Placenames in Silverdale
page.content: {The Crystal Well}in Warton parish near the three cottages at Crag Foot on the left of the road to Carnforth was the source of water until after the last war. The spring was of some depth, a bucket being lowered and filled. It was never known to run dry. Sadly lorries began to use the water for cleaning, no doubt contaminating the pure supply. Now little can be seen of the crystal waters. {Crag Foot Chimney}brick built and in the garden of the cottage was the saw mill furnace for Leighton Hall estate, making gates etc. The smithy was where the first house on the right of the crag road now stands. A man who built St. John's Church built it for his own use during his stay. It reverted to the Gillow estate.
